turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about B in the Mix: The Remixes.
turn.1: What was the working title of the album B in the Mix: The Remixes?
turn.2: The album was originally titled "Remixed", however, it was later revealed it would be titled "B in the Mix: The Remixes".
turn.3: Did they change the working title of the album?
turn.4: "B in the Mix: The Remixes" had two cover artworks: North American one and international one.
turn.5: What was the difference between the two cover arts?
turn.6: On the North American edition, Spears doesn't appear on the cover artwork; there is a red butterfly instead.
turn.7: Why did they decide to put a butterfly on the cover instead of a picture of Britney?
turn.8: Vineyard noted this, stating: "[the album] is being marketed in a more underground way than usually associated with a superstar act".
turn.9: Did the album win any awards?
turn.10: On the international edition cover artwork, a black-and-white image of Spears appears behind the butterfly. "B in the Mix: The Remixes" received little promotion compared to Spears' standards.
turn.11: What was some of the promotion that was done?
turn.12: A promotional extended play (EP) titled "Key Cuts from Remixed" with several remixes from the album was released in September 2005. A contest was launched on Spears' paid fan site for those who pre-ordered the album.
